discourse_list.title: Intangible Assets as Public goods - Questions for Oracle Core Unit

content.content: This document is dedicated to hold information from the Oracles Core Unit on whether the assets it produces by funding from MakerDAO will be made public goods for the DAO. It is posted as a main document to ensure it is easier to reference later than if the questions and answers were posted in a response thread for example concerning budget somewhere else. The latest budget request from the Oracles Core Unit can be seen here    MIP40c3-SP75: Modify Oracles Core Unit Budget, ORA-001 Archive   MIP40c3-SP75: Modify Oracle Core Unit Budget, ORA-001  Preamble MIP40c3-SP#: 75 Author(s): Niklas Kunkel (@NiklasKunkel) Contributors: Tags: core-unit, cu-ora-001, budget Status: Accepted Date Applied: 2022-07-06 Date Ratified: 2022-08-22 Budget Start Date: 2022-07-01 Budget End Date: 2023-06-30 Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip40c3-sp75-modify-oracles-core-unit-budget-ora-001/16397 Ratification Poll URL: https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/Qma3P8v9 Extra: Winning option was C: Approve …     The questions can be seen here, and are also inserted below. @NikKunkel feel free to edit this post or provide your answers as a response.  Questions  Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy , so you are aware of how to utilize the Dai, Maker and MakerDAO names and logos? Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO? Will the assets produced using MakerDAO funding be made available as public goods for the whole DAO? Specifically:  Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced? Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets? Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant  in your Github repositories? Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?   Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate? Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels? If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?
This topic was automatically closed after 90 days. New replies are no longer allowed.

discourse_list.title: Intangible Assets as Public goods - Questions for Immunefi Security Core Unit (IS-001)

content.content: This document is dedicated to hold information from the Immunefi Security Core Unit on whether the assets it produces by funding from MakerDAO will be made public goods for the DAO. It is posted as a main document to ensure it is easier to reference later than if the questions and answers were posted in a response thread for example concerning budget somewhere else. The latest budget request from the Core Unit can be seen here    MIP40c3-SP83: Modify Immunefi Security Core Unit Budget (IS-001) RFC   MIP40c3-SP83: Modify Immunefi Security Core Unit Budget (IS-001)  Preamble MIP40c3-SP#:83 Author(s): @psychonaut Contributors: @travinimmunefi Tags: core-unit, cu-is-001, budget, dai-budget Status: Date Applied: 2022-10-04 Date Ratified: <yyyy-mm-dd> Budget Start Date: 2022-12-01 Budget End Date: 2023-12-01 Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip40c3-sp83-immunefi-security-core-unit-budget-renewal-is-001/18209   Sentence Summary Renew the DAI budget for Core Unit IS-001: Immunefi Security.  …     @psychonaut -feel free to edit this post or provide your answers as a response.  Questions   Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy , so you are aware of how to utilize the Dai, Maker and MakerDAO names and logos?   Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO?   Will the assets produced using MakerDAO funding be made available as public goods for the whole DAO?   Specifically:   Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced?   Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets?   Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in your Github repositories?   Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?   Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate?   Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels?   If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?

Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy  Yes. We don’t communicate with the public so this policy is unlikely to come into play.  Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO?   Discussions of bug reports, both valid and invalid are stored at https://bugs.immunefi.com/  We maintain GitHub - makerdao-is/Forta-Agents    Will the assets produced using MakerDAO funding be made available as public goods for the whole DAO?  Bug reports are shared at the discretion of ISCU. The Forta agents are licensed with GPLv3.  Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced?  Yes  Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets?  The bulk of the work for the Forta agents was done by outside contributors. Since the GPL license ensures that the code will remain available for our use, we will not be pursuing copywrite re-assignments.  Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in your Github repositories?  This would be something that we would do if our CU planned to create substantial artifacts. We currently have no such plans.  Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?  The bugs reports will not be made public. The Forta agents are already publically available and will remain so.  Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate?  We communicate with Immunefi via Telegram, email, google drive, and the bug tracker.  Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels?  Yes sir!  If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?  N/A CC: @TravinImmunefi

psychonaut:  We don’t communicate with the public so this policy is unlikely to come into play.   Hey, Josh. Not sure what you mean here. I would expect anyone running a bug bounty program to communicate with the public, to advertize the program, manage the candidates, etc.

juan:  I would expect anyone running a bug bounty program to communicate with the public, to advertize the program, manage the candidates, etc.   Hm, yeah, fair point. I was thinking that it’s more of a marketing concern, but I suppose it would be possible to violate the trademark policy in the bug bounty invitation. In any case, I re-read the policy to refresh my memory.
This topic was automatically closed after 90 days. New replies are no longer allowed.

discourse_list.title: Intangible Assets as Public goods - Questions for Governance Communications Core Unit (COM-001)

content.content: This document is dedicated to hold information from the Governance Communications Core Unit on whether the assets it produces by funding from MakerDAO will be made public goods for the DAO. It is posted as a main document to ensure it is easier to reference later than if the questions and answers were posted in a response thread for example concerning budget somewhere else. The latest budget request from the Core Unit can be seen here     MIP40c3-SP84: Modify Core Unit Budget (COM-001) RFC   MIP40c3-SP84: Modify Core Unit Budget (COM-001)  Preamble MIP40c3-SP#: 84 Author(s): David Utrobin Contributors: Tags: core-unit, cu-com-001, budget, dai-budget Status: RFC Date Applied: 2022-10-05 Date Ratified:  Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip40c3-sp84-modify-core-unit-budget-com-001/18250   Sentence Summary This proposal renews the Governance Communications Core Unit budget details and extends funding for six months from January 1st, 2023, through June 30th, 2023.   Paragraph Sum…     @davidutro -feel free to edit this post or provide your answers as a response.  Questions   Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy , so you are aware of how to utilize the Dai, Maker and MakerDAO names and logos?   Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO?   Will the assets produced using MakerDAO funding be made available as public goods for the whole DAO?   Specifically:   Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced?   Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets?   Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in your Github repositories?   Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?   Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate?   Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels?   If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?

Hi Soren, thanks for this. Here are my answers.     sorenpeter:  Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy , so you are aware of how to utilize the Dai, Maker and MakerDAO names and logos?   Yes.     sorenpeter:  Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO?     makerdao.world domain (Not the content, since we are locked out and it is still technically owned by @seth from the former Content Production Core Unit) All of our trackers All Stakeholder Content Emergency Playbook & associated resource documents The Stakeholder Database and its associated policies.  If there is an asset of interest that is missing from this list, let us know @sorenpeter.     sorenpeter:  Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced?   We will apply these licenses to all assets where appropriate.     sorenpeter:  Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets?   Yes.     sorenpeter:  Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in your Github repositories?   No. It requests too many permissions of my personal github account. I may try the suggested workaround of creating a dedicated account and setting it as admin on any repos that need coverage.     sorenpeter:  Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?   All of the listed items above are public except:  The Stakeholder Database The Emergency Playbook  These two assets will continue to have restricted access.     sorenpeter:  Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate?   We also use our @makerdao.world emails to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to our mandate.     sorenpeter:  Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels?   Yes. We currently need to transfer makerdao.world.     sorenpeter:  If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?   Yes. We currently need to transfer makerdao.world.
This topic was automatically closed after 90 days. New replies are no longer allowed.

The latest budget request from the Core Unit can be seen here    MIP40c3-SP85: Modify Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit Budget (SAS-001) RFC   MIP40c3-SP85: Modify Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit Budget (SAS-001)  Preamble MIP40c3-SP#: 85 Author(s): @danik Contributors: @retro Tags: core-unit, cu-sas-001, budget, dai-budget Status: RFC Date Applied: <2022-10-06> Date Ratified: <yyyy-mm-dd> Ratification Poll URL:  Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip40c3-sp85-modifying-sidestream-auction-services-core-unit-budget-sas-001/18253   Sentence Summary MIP40c3-SP85 modifies the DAI budget for the SAS-001 Core Unit , continuing an…     @danik -feel free to edit this post or provide your answers as a response.  Questions   Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy , so you are aware of how to utilize the Dai, Maker and MakerDAO names and logos?   Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO?   Will the assets produced using MakerDAO funding be made available as public goods for the whole DAO?   Specifically:   Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced?   Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets?   Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in your Github repositories?   Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?   Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate?   Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels?   If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?

sorenpeter:   Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy , so you are aware of how to utilize the Dai, Maker and MakerDAO names and logos?    Yes     sorenpeter:   Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO?    Code of the Unified Auctions UI and other software products     sorenpeter:   Will the assets produced using MakerDAO funding be made available as public goods for the whole DAO?    All produced code and history is open source, see here - everyone can use it, open issues and contribute through pull requests. Another open source repo     sorenpeter:   Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced?    Yes, the code is under the following license: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0     sorenpeter:   Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets? Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in your Github repositories?    So far we followed the incubation program guidelines for licensing (making it open source) - I’ll discuss with you whether this is necessary in our case and if so, will do it.     sorenpeter:   Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?    yes, it is public - see above     sorenpeter:   Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate?    yes, there is a Twitter Account as part of the unified auctions Ui Product     sorenpeter:   Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels?    yes     sorenpeter:   If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?    Not planning to register any trademarks, but would transfer it to the Dai Foundation
This topic was automatically closed after 90 days. New replies are no longer allowed.

discourse_list.title: Intangible Assets as Public goods - Questions for TechOps Core Unit (TECH-001)

content.content: This document is dedicated to hold information from the TechOps Core Unit on whether the assets it produces by funding from MakerDAO will be made public goods for the DAO. It is posted as a main document to ensure it is easier to reference later than if the questions and answers were posted in a response thread for example concerning budget somewhere else. The latest budget request from the Core Unit can be seen here    MIP40c3-SP86: Modify TechOps Core Unit DAI Budget RFC   MIP40c3-SP86: Modify TechOps Core Unit DAI Budget (TECH-001)  Preamble MIP40c3-SP: #86 Author(s): @simonkp, @dumitru Contributors: @lukaszb, @Artautas Tags: core-unit, tech-001, core-unit-budget Status: RFC Date Applied: 2022-10-10 Date Ratified: <yyyy-mm-dd> Budget Start Date: 2023-02-01 Budget End Date: 2024-01-31 Forum URL: Ratification Poll URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip40c3-sp86-modify-techops-core-unit-dai-budget/18290   Sentence Summary MIP40c3-SP86 renews the TechOps Core Unit (T…     @simonkp @dumitru -feel free to edit this post or provide your answers as a response.  Questions   Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy , so you are aware of how to utilize the Dai, Maker and MakerDAO names and logos?   Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO?   Will the assets produced using MakerDAO funding be made available as public goods for the whole DAO?   Specifically:   Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced?   Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets?   Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in your Github repositories?   Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?   Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate?   Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels?   If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?

Here are our answers to the questions  Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy , so you are aware of how to utilize the Dai, Maker and MakerDAO names and logos?  Yes  Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO?   Infrastructure as Code - Terraform scripts Various scripts and functions Monitoring and testing scripts and functions Documentation   Will the assets produced using MakerDAO funding be made available as public goods for the whole DAO?  Yes  Specifically:  Open source parts of the assets from the above answer  Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced?  Those that are Open Sourced sure.  Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets?  Yes  Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in your Github repositories?  Yes  Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?  Some but not all for security purposes.  Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate?  Slack, Signal, Email, Google Drive  Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels?  Yes  If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?  Yes
This topic was automatically closed after 90 days. New replies are no longer allowed.

The budget request from RWF-0x Core Unit, which currently is kept in RFC, can be seen here     MIP40c3-SP78: RWF-0x Budget Proposal through 2022 RFC   MIP40c3-SP78: RWF-0x Budget Proposal through 2022  Preamble MIP40c3-SP#: 78 Author: @christiancdpetersen Contributors: @teej and @eumenes Tags: core-unit, RWF-0x, budget Status: RFC Date Proposed: 2022-08-03 Date Approved: <yyyy-mm-dd> Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip40c3-sp-rwf-0x-budget-proposal-through-2022/16968   Sentence Summary MIP40c3-SP78 represents a budget for a new Core Unit —RWF-0x— through December 31, 2022. The budget for RWF-0x is derived from the split of RWF-001 int…     The questions can be seen here, and are also inserted below. @christiancdpetersen if relevant, feel free to edit this post or provide your answers as a response.  Questions  Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy , so you are aware of how to utilize the Dai, Maker and MakerDAO names and logos? Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO? Will the assets produced using MakerDAO funding be made available as public goods for the whole DAO? Specifically:  Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced? Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets? Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant  in your Github repositories? Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?   Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate? Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels? If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?

The budget proposal has been withdrawn per this post:    MIP40c3-SP78: RWF-0x Budget Proposal through 2022 Archive   @Gala - I am permanently withdrawing this proposal for MIP40c3-SP78. You can remove from RFC.

discourse_list.title: Intangible Assets as Public goods - Questions for DUX Core Unit

content.content: This document is dedicated to hold information from the Development & UX Core Unit (DUX-001) on whether the assets it produces by funding from MakerDAO will be made public goods for the DAO. It is posted as a main document to ensure it is easier to reference later than if the questions and answers were posted in a response thread for example concerning budget somewhere else. The latest budget request from the DUX Core Unit can be seen here    MIP40c3-SP82- Development & UX Core Unit Budget - DUX-001 RFC   MIP40c3-SP82: Development & UX Core Unit (DUX-001) Budget  Preamble MIP40c3-SP#: 82 Author(s): Deniz Yilmaz (@0xdeniz) Tags: core-unit, cu-dux-001, budget, dai-budget Status: RFC Date Applied: 2022-09-02 Date Ratified: <yyyy-mm-dd> Budget Start Date: 2023-02-01 Budget End Date: 2024-01-31 Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip40c3-sp82-development-ux-core-unit-budget-dux-001/17611   Sentence Summary MIP40c3-SP82 renews the Development & UX Core Unit (DUX-001) budget from February 1st 2023 …     @0xdeniz feel free to edit this post or provide your answers as a response.  Questions  Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy , so you are aware of how to utilize the Dai, Maker and MakerDAO names and logos? Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO? Will the assets produced using MakerDAO funding be made available as public goods for the whole DAO? Specifically:  Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced? Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets? Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in your Github repositories? Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?   Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate? Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels? If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?
Hi Soren, our team is travelling for our 2nd offsite of the year. We will address these questions together over the coming week and get back to you. Thanks!

sorenpeter:   Have you acquainted yourself with the Dai & Maker Trademark Policy , so you are aware of how to utilize the Dai, Maker and MakerDAO names and logos?    Yes.     sorenpeter:   Which types of tangible and intangible assets will you be producing with the funding received from MakerDAO?    Web applications (eg. Voting Portal) and related tooling (eg. blockchain scraping service, databases, relayers) which facilitates user interactions with the Maker protocol.     sorenpeter:   Will appropriate Open Source Software/Creative Commons licenses be applied to the assets produced?    Yes; all our code is published under the AGPL-3 license.     sorenpeter:   Will Copyright for those assets be assigned to the Dai Foundation that has as its mandate to safeguard MakerDAO intangible assets?    We added a copyright notice to our README’s to reflect this.     sorenpeter:   Will you integrate the Dai Foundation Contributor License Agreement Assistant in your Github repositories?    One of our developers attempted to use the CLA tool but felt insecure about the permissions the app was asking for. It seemed to appear that they were granting DAIF access to their personal GitHub account (including editing GitHub gists, and viewing their repositories including private repositories. We’re happy to grant access to any maker/maker-dux repositories but it seems like the app requires access to all repositories that the account is associated with—could you confirm Soren? Thank you!     sorenpeter:     Will the source code/material for the assets be made publicly available? How?      Yes; through our GitHub repository.     sorenpeter:   Besides the MakerDAO Forum and MakerDAO Discord, which communication channels do your core unit plan to use to communicate on behalf of MakerDAO according to your mandate?    Our Twitter account, and a Maker DUX Discord server that we use for internally coordinating day-to-day work and supporting our users.     sorenpeter:   Will you ensure that relevant publishing/community websites, email and SoMe accounts and associated DNS and ENS domains used for official MakerDAO communication for which you hold Content Management rights are under ownership of Dai Foundation to ensure ultimate Maker Governance control of who is using these channels?    For now we don’t believe transferring ownership of the DUX team’s operational & comms channels/platforms to DAIF is important as it incurs unnecessary overhead. We are willing to cooperate in case this matter is regarded as important by the community although it will distract us from creating real value.     sorenpeter:   If you register any trademarks to represent MakerDAO funded solutions will you transfer those trademarks to Dai Foundation for safe keeping?    Yes. – Apologies for the delay, and please feel free to comment on any of the above!

0xdeniz:  One of our developers attempted to use the CLA tool but felt insecure about the permissions the app was asking for. It seemed to appear that they were granting DAIF access to their personal GitHub account (including editing GitHub gists, and viewing their repositories including private repositories. We’re happy to grant access to any maker/maker-dux repositories but it seems like the app requires access to all repositories that the account is associated with—could you confirm Soren? Thank you!   Thanks Deniz, Is this when integrating CLA assistant with a repository, or in the situation where a developer pushing a PR accepts the license? I have asked Techops to look into this, but I would think a quick workaround could be to create a dedicated admin user to set up the integration for the necessary repositories in case there is an issue. Could you connect me with the person who tested this so we can clear this up?

Having looked into this after more detailed feedback, I can confirm that - for the Admin setting up the integration for a repository - the CLA assistant asks for access to things like GitHub gists, and both public and private repositories. This is due to the fact that the actual contributor license agreement text is stored in a Gist and that the integration also is possible to set up for private repositories. That the App is asking liberally for write access is unfortunately due to a limitation in the Github OAuth scopes where currently, you can’t scope source code access to read-only. (Ref: Authorizing OAuth Apps - GitHub Docs ) There is thus nothing we can change on the App side that will make this different. I will note that the App is built from the open source code available at GitHub - daifoundation/cla-assistant: Contributor License Agreement assistant (CLA assistant) forked from https://github.com/cla-assistant/cla-assistant, and it is run on a dedicated instance controlled by Dai Foundation and managed by TechOps to ensure no 3rd party gets access to the signatures being collected. However, I recognize there is no trustless way to verify that the actual deployment corresponds to the code in the repository, so if there is any concern I suggest a workaround where you either set up the integration with a dedicated admin users for the given repository, or give TechOps admin access so they can set up the integration. I can also confirm that the App only asks for read only access to the email address of developers that are prompted to sign the Contributor License Agreement  Authorize CLA Assistant - contributor1998×1403 183 KB  To sum it up: Permission access is needed for setup - Techops can help or a “burner-admin” account can be used. Contributors only have to allow read access to what their email address is …
This topic was automatically closed after 90 days. New replies are no longer allowed.

discourse_list.title: Intangible Assets as Public goods - Questions for Growth Core Unit

content.content: This document is dedicated to hold information from the Growth Core Unit on whether the assets it produces by funding from MakerDAO will be made public goods for the DAO. It is posted as a main document to ensure it is easier to reference later than if the questions and answers were posted in a response thread for example concerning budget somewhere else. The Growth CU has responded to the questions here as part of Intangible Asset Agreed Modification of Management requests to take over Content Management of www.makerdao.com and the MakerDAO Linkedin Page. You can see the answers to the questions here:     Intangible Asset Agreed Modification of Management 2022-08-23 - makerdao.com Growth   Action Date: 2022-08-30  Assets Asset Type: website and content Asset Owner: DAI Foundation Platform Manager: www.makerdao.com (IP: 76.76.21.241), makerdao.com (IP: 76.76.21.21) Content Manager: Growth CU, [email protected] Purpose: Revamp the makerdao.com website Last Modification: -   Supporters @Nadia @Derek @tadeo @prose11 Reasoning The Growth CU requests to carry out a full restructure of makerdao.com  Maker has gone through tremendous changes over the past years, however, the web…         Intangible Asset Agreed Modification of Management 2022-08-23 - MakerDAO Linkedin Page Growth   Action Date: 2022-08-30  Assets Asset Type: Social media account Asset Owner: DAI Foundation Platform Manager: linkedin.com Content Manager: Growth CU, [email protected] Purpose: share information and start conversations with the Maker ecosystem Last Modification: -   Supporters @Nadia @Derek @tadeo @prose11 Reasoning Maker Growth is making a formal request that management of the LinkedIn account is given to the Maker Brand team.  Following the recent MIP60 which requested maker growth…
